TopicTitle: Space Shuttle Pack for ksp 1.0.4 dev thread

Articles.Content:
> 
> Hmm, SNC Dreamchaser? Not bad there Mike, not bad at all. Now I have to find an a Atlas V to carry it!
> Not bad at all.

It comes with one

the mod will eventually come with all this, but I need to release the stack first. not 100% on the aero. 

to the testers: can you test/modify what we have so far, more people the better

I'm kinda nervous about the Dreamchaser as the original Dreamer mod was taken down from KerbalStuff because of a ***trademark infringement notice from SNC***. \*facepalm\* This is dumber than all of the false YouTube DMCA notices combined.

![Turbo_facepalm_by_specialvore-d69viv5.png](http://img4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20141222232555/glee/images/1/11/Turbo_facepalm_by_specialvore-d69viv5.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-05T00:50:33Z" title="07/05/2015 12:50  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 5, 2015</time> by hieywiey**
You would think that they would like there stuff replicated so it generates more interest free advertising really stupid if you ask me
interesting....

Are you serious?

The current version 1.6 it can not change some parts for example the crew cabin can not switch the name of the space shuttle and it not appears in the craft. I only can switch the name on the wings, why is this?
1.6 as it stands is a mostly WIP, and as such isn't fully working. The mod has come a long way since 1.6, however, and the new release is coming soon.
![ZTYGWyd.png](http://i.imgur.com/ZTYGWyd.png)

VERRY SOON! anyone up for a 1.7 preview? will need feedback on any lasting faults before proper release. I think its mostly there.

I've been lurking for a while, but decided to register, just cause of the CSS mod. Been using it quite a while, succesfully on 64bit too, so i'm curious to see how 1.0.7 will work out in 64bit 1.0.4 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

yes...

issues to be posted via pm messages please and I will remedy for proper release.
Happy to test on Linux 64

Took 1.6 through a couple of launches and it's okay as long as you don't try and roll into heads-down. I'm getting quite severe slewing to the side on roll. Might just be my awful piloting skills, tough.

The robotic arm is currently very unstable and messes around a lot with launch and landing stability due to it flapping about in payload bay.

The braking parachute is probably a bit too strong in the drag department. It is causing the Orbiter to roll and pitch on deploy in my stock game. 

Other big issue I found is the RCS jets on the nose cone are not working well. I don't know if this is to balance the RCS or just an error, but I found the vertical jets are not firing fro mthe correct place, and there is no 'reverse' translation jets?

Aside from that it looks sharp,

EDIT: Oh, also I tested this on stock 1.0.4 Linux x86\_64 and it seems to be okay, although it's laggy at low altitude, but it might just be my graphics settings as above a certain altitude it's suddenly fine.

parachute in SRB nosecone temporarily disabled. issues with 1.0.4 yet to fix

I need it too!

I noticed that the shuttle makes wayyyyy to much lift. it makes so much lift it dosnt stall untill 5/ms and it is nearly impossible to land as i goes strait up when i pull up the least bit.

Also when i does stall it rocks back and fourth in the air like a piece of paper. the aero for this mod is a mess ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png)
